name: Hardest Voices in the Dark: Over There Trivia Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: What planet is the Interstellar Alliance based on?
questions.explanation:
Minbar.

	Minbar is home to the Minbari people. Two main characters from there were members of the "Babylon 5" series' initial 5-year run, they were Delenn and Lennier. Among the members of the Interstellar Alliance, they were the most advanced race in terms of technology and spiritual enlightenment.

questions.text: John Sheridan, now President of the Interstellar Alliance, is travelling to Babylon 5 to celebrate how many years with the alliance?
questions.explanation:
10.

	Sheridan, formerly a Captain, was selected to lead the Interstellar Alliance. He was the former commander of the space station Babylon 5.  Played by Bruce Boxleitner, the character debuted in season 2 of "Babylon 5" and stuck around the rest of the series. This episode is about him celebrating the 10-year anniversary of the Interstellar Alliance, and his trip back to the space station.

questions.text: Which character, who was from the "Babylon 5" spinoff series "Crusade" came to warn Sheridan of impending doom?
questions.explanation:
Galen.

	Galen, played by Peter Woodward, hadn't appeared in an episode of "Babylon 5" before this episode of the "Lost Tales".  Galen was known as a techno-mage. He was a mystic who used technology to help him with his mystic ways. He warned Sheridan that Earth would be destroyed in 30 years unless Prince Vintari was killed.

questions.text: During an interview with an ISN reporter, Sheridan couldn't find her camera. Where was it?
questions.correct: Attached to the left breast of her jacket.
options: It was a new type of camera attached to her retina.
She refused to reveal where it was hidden.
questions.explanation:
Attached to the left breast of her jacket.

	She told Sheridan that her producers thought it would ensure he was looking at the camera, often. The reporter was played by Teryl Rothery.

questions.text: How did Sheridan agree to assassinate Prince Vintari?
questions.explanation:
In a Starfury accident.

	After Galen's revelation that Vintari would become emperor of the Centauri people, and would eventually decide to destroy the Earth he agreed to kill the prince. They set up a Starfury (fighter jet) to kill him when he tried piloting it. Eventually Sheridan decided not to go through with it, and instead tried to change Prince Vintari's outlook through friendship.

questions.text: What new form of space travel was revealed in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Quantumspace travel.

	The ability to travel through quantumspace allowed a ship to travel "twice as fast" as normal hyperspace travel.  The technology was integrated from equipment left from the Vorlon race when they left the known areas of space.

questions.text: President Sheridan was attacked during his flight into Babylon 5.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Throughout the episode there were no actual attacks on anyone. Sheridan was shown a possible future by Galen, during which there was an attack, but no attacks on anyone actually happened.

questions.text: Dr. Stephen Franklin and G'Kar did not return from the original series. What reason was given?
questions.correct: They were exploring beyond the rim.
options: Dr. Franklin was killed, G'Kar was in prison for it.
G'Kar was killed in battle, Dr. Franklin was working on Earth.
questions.explanation:
They were exploring beyond the rim.

	The true reason neither returned was the actors who played them had died in the years between production on "Babylon 5" and the "Lost Tales". Sheridan, while asking about who would be at the celebration, asked about them and was told about their exploration "beyond the rim".

Delenn.

	Delenn, who did not feature in the "Lost Tales" episodes, and Sheridan had married during the fourth season of "Babylon 5". He mentioned that she was busy doing her own things on Minbar, and couldn't attend the celebration. The couple had a 9-year-old son, David, during this episode.

questions.text: The space station was decommissioned immediately after the celebration.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The "Lost Tales" episodes were set in 2271. According to series continuity Babylon 5 wasn't decomissioned until 2281.  The station, built in 2256, was only functioning for 25 years. During that time, it was lead by Jeffrey Sinclair, John Sheridan and Elizabeth Lochley.  The station served the Earth Alliance, as an independent station and later the Interstellar Alliance.
